                   <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_left-to-right left-to-right">
                    <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                     <p style="text-align: right;">
                      The Bioref Masterâs program was built by four
                      <br>
                       recognized partners in their respective fields to address
                       <br>
                        the lack of training in the growing field of biorefineries.
                       </br>
                      </br>
                     </p>
                     <p style="text-align: right;">
                      You will learn to recognize usable biomass,
                      <br>
                       produce it, process it and transform it into chemical building blocks,
                       <br>
                        polymers and fuels.
                       </br>
                      </br>
                     </p>
                     <p style="text-align: right;">
                      You will also be able to assess the impact on the local environment of the implementation of such an industry in the rural world.
                     </p>

    <div class="page-heading">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
       <div class="col-md-8 col-sm-8">
        <h1>
         ABOUT BIOREF
        </h1>
       </div>
       <div class="pathway col-md-4 col-sm-4 hidden-xs text-right">
        <div class="breadcrumbs" xmlns:v="http://rdf.data-vocabulary.org/#">
         <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/" property="v:title" rel="v:url">
          Home
         </a>
         \
        </div>
        <!-- .breadcrumbs -->

      <!--/row-->

     <!--/container-->
    </div>
    <!--/page-heading-->
    <div class="top-sidebar">
     <div class="container">

      <!--/row-->

     <!--/container-->

    <div id="body">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="content-pad-3x">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12" id="content" role="main">
         <article class="single-page-content">
          <div class="wpb-content-wrapper">
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1573836418165" style="color: #048f39;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  BEFORE BIOREF MASTER: EUROBIOREF PROGRAMME
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The BIOREF Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree is a masterâs program in the field of biorefinery, which has been jointly developed by the University of Lille (
                   <a href="https://www.univ-lille.fr/home/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                    ULILLE
                   </a>
                   ) in France, the University of Bari (
                   <a href="https://www.uniba.it/english-version/university-of-bari-aldo-moro" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                    UNIBA
                   </a>
                   ) in Italy, the University of Technology of Troyes (
                   <a href="https://www.utt.fr" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                    UTT
                   </a>
                   ) in France and the Cracow University of Technology (
                   <a href="https://www.pk.edu.pl/index.php?lang=en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                    PK
                   </a>
                   ) in Poland. The key personnel involved in the design and the structuring of the Master programme have
                   <strong>
                    a long-standing collaboration in the frame of
                    <a href="http://eurobioref.org/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                     EuroBioRef
                    </a>
                    .
                   </strong>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   EuroBioRef, which stands for âEuropean Multilevel Integrated Biorefinery Design for Sustainable Biomass Processingâ, was a major European R&D project in the field of biomass conversion which came to an end at the end of 2013. The project included 29 partners in 15 countries and had a budget of â¬ 38 million, of which â¬ 23 million were donated by the European Commission under the FP7 research programme. The main goal of the EuroBioRef project was to develop a new highly integrated and diversified biorefinery concept including multiple feedstocks (non-edible), multiple processes (chemical, biochemical, thermochemical), and multiple products (aviation fuels and chemicals).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1573057155440 vc_row-has-fill">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
              <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1573057231947">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1573057218183" style="color: #c6d30a;text-align: center">
                 <strong>
                  Besides the research issues that were dealt with in the frame of EuroBioRef, the project included extensive training activities in order to :
                 </strong>
                </h3>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ol>
                   <li>
                    Instruct and train all people involved with production and usage ofÂ  biorefineries including industrials, students or research people;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Organise staff training in order to transfer the necessary technological knowledge and to teach;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Disseminate specific knowledge from experts in EuroBioRef to young scientists and facilitate the exchange of good practice among the high level partners involved in different domains;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Provide personal and distance-learning training to extend Science & Technology understanding of the biorefinery concept, and in parallel, promote S&T cohesion within the European Research Area and so increase skills across Europe;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Provide an overview of innovation in the field (M. Aresta, A. Dibenedetto. F. Dumeignil Eds, âBiorefinery: from biomass to chemicals and fuelsâ, De Gruyter Publ, 2013) and a tool for presenting to advanced students the state-of-the-art of this new branch of industrial chemistry (M. Aresta, A. Dibenedetto, F. Dumeignil Eds: âBiorefineries: An introductionâ De Gruyter Publ, 2015).
                   </li>
                  </ol>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
              <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1573810623072">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_right wpb_content_element img-bottom">
                 <figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure">
                  <div class="vc_single_image-wrapper vc_box_border_grey">
                   <img alt="" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-full" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="554" sizes="(max-width: 585px) 100vw, 585px" src="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/etudiante-bioref.png" srcset="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/etudiante-bioref.png 585w, https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/etudiante-bioref-300x284.png 300w, https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/etudiante-bioref-255x241.png 255w" title="etudiante-bioref" width="585"/>
                  </div>
                 </figure>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1573055660792">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The key actors of the consortium of the present Bioref Master Programme were heavily involved in all above tasks during EuroBioRef and plan to transfer the expertise gained in the EU large Project into the proposed Master. As a matter of fact, the idea for the present Master course stemmed from the participation in the training activities within EuroBioRef, where it became clear
                   <strong>
                    that there is a lack of specialized training and education in the topic of biorefineries and biomass valorisation in Europe and worldwide, especially in developing countries
                   </strong>
                   .
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_left wpb_content_element">
                 <figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure">
                  <div class="vc_single_image-wrapper vc_box_border_grey">
                   <img alt="bandeau-bioref" class="vc_single_image-img" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" src="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/bandeau-bioref.jpg" title="bandeau-bioref" width="1140"/>
                  </div>
                 </figure>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1572882246198" style="color: #048f39;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  AFTER EUROBIOREF â BIOREF MASTER
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Since Eurobioref clearly demonstrated the lack of specialized, high-level workforce in the field of biorefineries, the logical continuation was the education of skilled individuals who would be able to interact and work in such new biomass-based industries, integrating its environmental impacts along the value chains. Building on the acquired experience and expertise, the four participating Universities have designed an integrated, highly effective two-year Master Programme of specialized education in biomass exploitation to multiple fuels and chemicals in an integrated sustainable biorefinery concept.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <strong>
                    The programme has been designed to offer unique specialization to its students and skills that will make them attractive to the employment sector and ensure fast and high-quality employability in the labour market and/or in research (PhD).
                   </strong>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
          </div>
         </article>
        </div>
        <!--/content-->
       </div>
       <!--/row-->
      </div>
      <!--/content-pad-3x-->
     </div>
     <!--/container-->
    </div>
    <!--/body-->
    <section id="bottom-sidebar">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="row normal-sidebar">
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>
    <footer class="dark-div main-color-2-bg">
     <section id="bottom">
      <div class="section-inner">
       <div class="container">
        <div class="row normal-sidebar">
         <div class="col-md-3 widget widget_text" id="text-15">
          <div class="widget-inner">
           <div class="textwidget">
            <p>
             <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/logo-bioref-european-master-blc-1.png">
              <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-137287" decoding="async" height="79" loading="lazy" src="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/logo-bioref-european-master-blc-1.png" width="82"/>
             </a>
            </p>
            <p>

                   <area alt="Bari" coords="429,547,513,609" href="https://master-bioref.eu/the-university-of-bari-aldo-moro/" shape="rect" target="" title="Bari"/>
                  </map>

                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Bioref is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree in Bio-refinery organized by a
                   <strong>
                    consortium of four Universities
                   </strong>
                   and Graduate Schools across Europe:
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/university-of-troyes/">
                     University of Troyes in France (UTT)
                    </a>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/cracow-university-of-technology/">
                     Cracow University of Technology in Poland (PK)
                    </a>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/the-university-of-bari-aldo-moro/">
                     The University of Bari Aldo Moro, Italy
                    </a>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/university-of-lille/">
                     The University of Lille, France
                    </a>
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The map shows the location of each university.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The University of Lille is the
                   <strong>
                    coordinating institution
                   </strong>
                   of the Bioref Consortium.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   All these universities are
                   <strong>
                    highly qualified and experienced
                   </strong>
                   in bio-refinery, catalytic process, bioeconomy, but also in biomass conversion and production, and in teaching courses related toit.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   In addition they have
                   <strong>
                    strong links with the professionals
                   </strong>
                   of the chemical industry and chemical organizations in Europe and in the world as proved by the many associated partners of the Bioref project. The Bioref master can also count on institutional partners who help to develop the bio-economy in their region.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>

                  </div>

                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1575295294309">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Coordinating institution of the BioRefConsortium
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Laureate 2017 of I-SITE label
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    <a href="https://www.univ-lille.fr/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                     Univ-Lille website
                    </a>
                   </li>
                  </ul>

                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1575295330209">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <h4 style="color: white; text-align: center;">
                   FEW FIGURES
                  </h4>
                  <p>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    72Â 000 students
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">

                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    An important choice of disciplines
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    7 research facilities of excellence (EQUIPEX)
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    5 laboratories of excellence (LABEX).
                   </span>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-8 vc_col-has-fill">
              <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574944679707">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="color: #289b33;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  UNIVERSITY OF LILLE
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The University of Lille is a multi-disciplinary university of Excellency based in the north of Europe.Â  The University can count on an exceptional cultural and scientific patrimony inscribed in the Hauts de France region.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The University of Lille is one of the main actor in the region in terms of formation, research and innovation.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Over the past years, the University of Lille has increasingly placed its international outlook at the heart of its administration, academic programmes and research. As the laureate in 2017 of a vast national program to fund academic excellence (I-SITE), the University of Lille is committed to organizing its international programmes around selected research strands, international student recruitment methods and high-quality international partnerships.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1574937012824" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      STRUCTURED, HIGH LEVEL RESEARCH
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       The University of Lille houses 66 laboratories and research units covering all fields of study. The quality of its research has been widely recognized on the national level through the awarding of prestigious labels and funding: an I-SITE project, seven research facilities of excellence (EQUIPEX) and five laboratories of excellence (LABEX).
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       The universityâs many research groups, networks and facilities contribute to effective multidisciplinary research, as well as to its valorisation via socio economic partnerships. These projects include an integrated cancer research site (SiricOncolille), an institute for energy transition (ITE) and a technology transfer group (SATT). The university belongs to a network including five technology parks and seven competitiveness clusters, which allows businesses and laboratories to collaborate on innovation in cutting-edge sectors.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       The University of Lille has high-level research facilities covering a wide range of fields, information and technology sciences and health sciences (molecular and cellular imaging, biotherapy, genomics, proteomics and bioinformatics, promotion of clinical knowledge development, medical imaging and visual sciences and cultures).
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       Research is also supported by joint research services, in physico-chemistry centre for analysis, the department of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and the department of mass spectrometry and of cytometry and cell sorting.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574940277725">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1574939262454" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      PATNERS AND NETWORKS
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       The universityâs international ambition is put into practice through institutional networks and agreements, particularly within the European Universities Association(EUA), Agence universitaire de la Francophonie (AUF),Institut des AmÃ©riques, the French-Dutch Network andCampus France, an organization established by the French government to promote French higher education abroad. It is also a member of several international student exchange programmes: the International Student ExchangePrograms (around 60 different countries), the France-Quebec Inter university Cooperation Office, the Erasmus +programme. It also collaborates with institutions in other countries through numerous bilateral agreements. It has also established structured partnerships with several consortia of universities.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574960141377">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1574960176049" style="color: #c6d30a;text-align: center">
                     <strong>
                      RESEARCH AND ENVIRONMENT
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       <em style="color: #c6d30a;">
                        ULille has 1,400 PhD students yearly working with the 44 research laboratories on campus, two-thirds of which are supported by the State CNRS. Areas of excellence include Electronics; Engineering and Computer Science, Materials, Bio production, Optics and Chemistry. City, Space and Society are mainly handled by economists. Research at ULille is supported by a Regional and the National Committee (French Ministry of research and the CNRS) and also by European Research Development projects. Some laboratories develop a European strategy by creating âjoint European laboratoriesâ.
                       </em>
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>

                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="color: #289b33;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  CRACOW UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The biggest advantages of Cracow University of Technology (CUT) are: almost 80-year-old tradition of educating engineers, modernity and openness to change as well as hard work on the improvement of the Polish scientific and technical thought. Thanks to them CUT won a strong position and well established brand.
                  </p>

                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1576139451569" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      FACULTY OF CHEMICAL ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       The origins of the Faculty of the result of the demand for highly qualified engineering staff for the rapidly developing region in the southern Polish chemical industry. In 1990 it was renamed the Department of Chemical Engineering and Technology which was highlighted by educating students and conducting scientific research on the broader chemical technology and chemical engineering.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       Graduates of our Faculty are prepared to work with a technology and engineering, and scientific research in the wider chemical industry. During the studies familiar with the background technology of organic and inorganic chemistry, biotechnology, and chemical engineering. They learn about environmentally friendly non-waste energy- and material technologies, new solutions that reduce industryâs environmental impact, the technologies related with refining industry, production of fine chemicals, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, household products, pesticides, materials for electronics, construction chemicals. In addition, technologies of polymers, methods of determination the properties, processing and recycling of plastics. Modern solutions in the field of biopolymers, synthesis of nanomaterials and catalysts. They gain knowledge of the biotechnological process engineering, environmental protection and energy generation from renewable sources. In addition, they have the opportunity to learn modern methods of physicochemical and physical measurements in chemical analysis.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       We educate students on three areas: Chemical Technology, Chemical and Process Engineering and Biotechnology. In addition, we offer full MSc program in English within specialty of Innovative Chemical Technologies, and we are constantly expanding our offer of courses for MSc and BSc students in English.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574940277725">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1576147087498" style="text-align: center">
                     <strong>
                      We give our students the most durable capital in the labor market : knowledge
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       The Faculty has the right to confer doctoral degrees in technical sciences disciplines in the chemical technology and chemical engineering and chemical sciences in the discipline of chemistry. Since 1998, we educate doctoral students together with the Institute of Catalysis and Surface Chemistry of the Polish Academy of Sciences, part of the International Doctoral Studies, and since 2006 also independently within the faculty, doctoral studies in the field of chemical engineering.
                       <br/>
                       As of 28 March 2011. Department of Chemical Engineering and Technology Cracow University of Technology, the decision of the Central Commission for Academic Degrees and Titles, obtained the right to confer postdoctoral degree.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574960141377">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       <em style="color: #c6d30a;">
                        Cracow University of Technology comprises 8 faculties with 30 majors of study accredited by the Polish Accreditation Committee (12 degree programmes are given in English). Also the majors taught by the Faculty of Civil Engineering and the Faculty of Architecture are accredited by the European Network for Accreditation of Engineering Education. Moreover the major in Architecture is accredited by the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA) and the major in Landscape Architecture earned the accreditation of the International Federation of Landscape Architects (IFLA) Europe. Cracow University of Technology was awarded the Logo Human Resources Excellence in Research by the European Commission.
                        <br/>
                        Cooperation with many universities and scientific centres all over the world enables joint publications and research, exchange of students and academic teachers, as well as the possibility of obtaining additional certificates and double diplomas. Cooperation with industry is also well-developed, and a Technology Transfer Centre is active in the university. A Special Economic Zone â the Cracow Technological Park â was created in 1997 as a reply for a call from the university. It has since become a platform linking the Cracovian scientific world with modern technologies.
                       </em>
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>

                   <img alt="" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-medium" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="292" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" src="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Logo-et-photo-Bari-1-300x292.png" srcset="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Logo-et-photo-Bari-1-300x292.png 300w, https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Logo-et-photo-Bari-1-50x50.png 50w, https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Logo-et-photo-Bari-1-255x248.png 255w, https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Logo-et-photo-Bari-1.png 370w" title="Logo et photo Bari" width="300"/>
                  </div>
                 </figure>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1576147671956">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   <a href="https://www.uniba.it/english-version" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                    <strong>
                     University of Bari Aldo Moro Website
                    </strong>
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1576147648057">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <h4 style="color: white; text-align: center;">
                   NATIONAL EVALUATION OUTPUT
                  </h4>
                  <p>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    <a href="http://(http://www.anvur.org/index.php?lang=it),">
                     The University and Research National Evaluation Agency
                    </a>
                    through the Assessment of Research Quality (VQR) project, ranks the organisations evaluating the research produced as well as their ability to attract external funding. One of the most descriptive indexes is the âfinal indicator for research (IRFD)â. The VQR 2004-2010 data states that:
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    The IRFD of the Department of Chemistry of UNIBA is 4th in the ranking out of 14 Chemistry Departments in Italy; this ranking isalso the highest of all the Departments of UNIBA;
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    The elicited IRSF is also 29th out of 113 Departments that have submitted products in the research area of Chemistry (Area 3);
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    The ability to attract external research funding (at the regional, national and European level) is also high. According to the VQR the UNIBA Chemistry Department, having attracted almost 25 M in the past four years, is ranked in the first top 25 percent at the national level, and alone constitutes 23% of the entire research funding budget awarded to UNIBA.
                    <br/>
                   </span>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-8 vc_col-has-fill">
              <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574944679707">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="color: #289b33;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  UNIVERSITY OF BARI ALDO MORO
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The University of Bari Aldo Moro was founded in 1925 and is attended today by about 60,000 students, across the Bari, Brindisi, and Taranto campuses. The University was named after one of its most famous students, the statesman Aldo Moro. Moro taught Criminal Law at the University of Bari for several years.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The University offers various courses for undergraduate, graduate and post-graduate students. Aside from teaching, the University is also focused on scientific research at the doctorate level. The University of Bari research centres are highly-interactive, having connections among different departments, universities, and other research centres.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The University of Bari Aldo Moro promotes the assistance and University integration of disabled students providing a series of initiatives to guarantee services and technical and didactical aids.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  THE DEPARTMENT OF CHEMISTRY
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The department of chemistry in UNIBA was founded in 1982 and is presently composed of almost 50 tenure-track professors and limited-term researchers as well as technicians and administrative staff. Courses are offered in all the Chemistry disciplines (General, Inorganic, Analytical, Organic and Physical Chemistry) as well as different Degree Courses at UNIBA. The Department coordinates the Degree Courses (Laurea) in Chemistry and Environmental Sciences (Bachelorâs Degree, 3 years) as well as in Chemical Sciences and Technologies and Material Sciences and Technologies (Masterâs Degree, 2 years). A PhD School in Chemical and Molecular Sciences (3 years) is offered as well. Moreover, the Department also hosts researchers and technical/administrative staff belonging to three institutes of the National Research Council..
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1576147222350" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      AVAILABLE FACILITIES AND MAIN RESEARCH TOPICS
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        Available facilities:
                       </strong>
                       The scientific research carried out within the Department are in line with HORIZON 2020 strategic directions and are developed in close collaboration with national and international public and private research centres. The Department offers many facilities (numerous research labs, one library, 2 computing stations, 2 research interdepartmental centres, research facilities) which provide a friendly stimulating atmosphere and allow to perform advanced research in many interdisciplinary fields.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        Main research topics:
                       </strong>
                       The most relevant research themes are schematically listed below: â soft matter bioelectronics â plasma processes for fundamental chemistry and industrial applications â advanced materials for biomedical applications â organic and hybrid materials for optoelectronics â chemistry of metals in biological systems biological and inorganic Systems â laser, plasma and molecules â physical chemistry of complex systems â computational chemistry â environmentally friendly processes and catalysis â chemicals and fuels from renewable sources â antimicrobial nanomaterials in mass spectrometry and sensors â innovative methods in mass spectrometry for food, clinical and cultural heritage â Â«Â omicsÂ Â» sciences and advanced applications of mass spectrometry â sustainable technologies for synthesis and biotechnology applications.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574940277725">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1576147462239" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      CUTAMC
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       There is also a UNIVERSITY CENTRE FOR THEATRE, VISUAL ARTS, MUSIC AND CINEMA (CUTAMC) which has the following purposes:
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       â development of studies and research, in the field of the visual arts, music, theatre and cinema;
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       â realisation/the purchasing of scientific books and laboratories;
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       â promotion and the organization of meetings, conferences, performances and documentary, artistic and bibliographic shows, workshop and exchange experience even if abroad.
                       <strong>
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574960141377">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1576147444458" style="color: #c6d30a;text-align: center">
                     <strong>
                      SPORT AT UNIVERSITY
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       <em style="color: #c6d30a;">
                        The University of Bari has a UNIVERSITY SPORT CENTRE (C.U.S.). Enrolment starts on 1stÂ September and lasts till 31stÂ Â Â August of the following year. All the Erasmus enrolled students may practice the following sports activities:
                        <br/>
                        Indoor swimming pool, outdoor swimming pool, indoor sports facilities and skating rink, tennis court, football ground, basketball, athletics tracks and fields. CUS organises also courses of: fitness (1stÂ September â 30thÂ June), swimming for the duration of three months (1stÂ October â 30thÂ June), body-building, aerobics, toning gymnastics and personal training.
                       </em>
                      </p>
                     </div>

                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1576145961932">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <ul>
                   <li>

                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1575994923841">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <h4 style="color: white; text-align: center;">
                   AN XXL CAMPUS
                  </h4>
                  <p>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    2 industrial halls of 2,200 m2
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    2,000 m2 of library space
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    5,000 m2 of laboratories and research platforms
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    4,000 m2 dedicated to sports activities
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    1 antenna in Nogent (52)
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    The UTT is located at the heart of a campus and ecosystem conducive to innovation, with, less than 1 kilometre away, the IUT, the Technopole de lâAube en Champagne and its young entrepreneur centre and 3 other schools: the EPF, the ESTP and the Groupe ESC Troyes.
                   </span>
                   <br/>
                   <span style="color: white;">
                    <i class="fas fa-vial">
                    </i>
                    In 10 years, with 10,400 students, Troyes and its metropolitan area have tripled the number of students. Troyes is now an attractive city for young people pursuing higher education.
                    <br/>
                    The 2017 list of Â«Â cities where it is good to studyÂ Â» published by LâÃtudiant attests to this: Troyes ranks 5th.
                   </span>
                  </p>

             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-8 vc_col-has-fill">
              <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574944679707">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="color: #289b33;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  UNIVERSITY OF TROYES
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="color: #000000;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  Presentation of the UTT and its missions
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Research, training and technology transfer are the three missions of the Troyes University of Technology (UTT). A public institution created in Troyes in 1994, UTT is now one of the 10 largest engineering schools in France.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   It trains more than 3100 students each year, from post-baccalaureate to bac+5 and bac+8
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="color: #000000;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  Training combining excellence and innovation
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Both a university and a âGrande Ecoleâ, UTT relies on its 8 research teams to offer training courses covering the entire university spectrum: Bachelor, Master, Engineer and Doctorate, short professionalizing courses (University Diplomas), specialized MasterÂ® programmes and language certifications.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Its training courses provide graduates with the skills required by companies.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The 5-year engineering course, approved by the CTI (engineering titles commission), is individualized from the first year and allows each student to adapt his training to his professional project.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1574937012824" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      STRUCTURED, HIGH LEVEL RESEARCH
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        A networked university
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       UTT is a member of the Conference of Directors of French Engineering Schools (CDEFI), the Conference of Grandes Ecoles (CGE), the Conference of University Presidents (CPU).
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       The UTT is a member of the UT Group. It brings together the four universities of technology with the UTBM (Belfort-MontbÃ©liard) and the UTC (CompiÃ¨gne) as well as the UTSEUS (Sino-European University of Technology of the University of Shanghai created in 2005).
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        A research model focused on excellence
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       The UTTâs research is structured around the Charles Delaunay Institute (ICD), a research unit associated with the CNRS. It brings together all the UTTâs research actors.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       Two transversal themes provide an interdisciplinary research framework for ICD teams:
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       â Global Security
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       â Services and Industry of the Future
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        In interaction with the economic world
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       From the outset, UTT has developed a strong capacity to work closely with companies in the fields of partnership research, innovation, and initial and continuing training.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       It has strong links with the economic world. More than 3000 companies are partners of the university.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        A pedagogy that favours tailor-made courses and student innovation
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       UTT values student initiative, commitment and entrepreneurship as an integral part of the training of women and men ready to imagine the future, to manage complexity, to adapt to change while mobilizing advanced scientific and technological skills.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid">
                 <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill">
                  <div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1574940277725">
                   <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                    <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1574939262454" style="text-align: left">
                     <strong>
                      PATNERS AND NETWORKS
                     </strong>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                     <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        A public institution accessible to all
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       Tuition fees are set by the Ministry of Higher Education, Research and Innovation.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       The university welcomes 28% of scholarship students.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <strong>
                        A strategy of openness and construction of the future
                       </strong>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       UTT is also an actor in the economic and social development of its territory, Aube, Champagne and Grand Est. It actively participates in the dynamics of innovative ecosystems through projects and academic, territorial and scientific groups.
                      </p>
                      <h2>
                       High quality partnerships
                      </h2>
                      <p>
                       <em>
                        The UTT is strongly engaged in international development at every level:
                       </em>
                       <br/>
                       <em>
                        exchange of students, research collaboration, cosupervised thesis, internships, staff mobility, industrial partnerships, double degrees, tailor-made summer programs, and intensive language and cultural programs.
                       </em>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <em>
                        Everyone at the UTT is involved in developing strong ties with renowned partners all over the world.
                       </em>
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       <em>
                        Feel free to contact international.center@utt.fr if you would like to join us in the promotion of international cooperation in engineering education and scientific research, thus enriching cross-cultural understanding between nations and shaping the future of globalisation.
                       </em>
                      </p>

      <div class="content-pad-3x">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12" id="content" role="main">
         <article class="single-page-content">
          <div class="wpb-content-wrapper">
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1573836029813" style="color: #048f39;text-align: left">
                 Frequently Asked Questions - Master BioRef
                </h2>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
                 <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-classic vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
                  <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
                   <div class="vc_tta-panels">
                    <div class="vc_tta-panel vc_active" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1573649713931-1424629b-260d">
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                      <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                       <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1573649713931-1424629b-260d">
                        <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                         I have a double nationality (programme as well as partner country) : for which scholarship should i apply?
                        </span>
                        <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                        </i>
                       </a>
                      </h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                      <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                        <p>
                         You have to choose at the moment of application under which nationality you wish to apply. For the one that you indicate in your application form you will be considered for scholarship. Note that if you have spent more than 12 months in EU, during the last 5 years before the date of application you are considered automatically as programme country.
                        </p>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1573649713951-428960c0-e6d3">
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                      <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                       <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1573649713951-428960c0-e6d3">
                        <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                         I have not graduated yet, can i apply ?
                        </span>
                        <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                        </i>
                       </a>
                      </h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                      <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                        <p>
                         Yes you can, students in their last year of BSc study can also apply before the application deadline. They need to show proof of their studies with a duly signed and stamped statement that declares they are currently in their last year. They need to include the transcript of records showing all courses completed and all uncompleted courses for which they are enrolled. The statement should mention in which month they are expecting to obtain the diploma.
                        </p>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1582818278001-96c1700b-15fd">
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                      <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                       <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1582818278001-96c1700b-15fd">
                        <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                         When do my referees receive the email to download their reference letter?
                        </span>
                        <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                        </i>
                       </a>
                      </h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                      <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                        <p>
                         Your referrals will receive the link once you have completed your application.
                        </p>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
                 <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-classic vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
                  <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
                   <div class="vc_tta-panels">
                    <div class="vc_tta-panel vc_active" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1575292691276-e0c6d6a2-a393">
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                      <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                       <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1575292691276-e0c6d6a2-a393">
                        <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                         I have completed my application form but I didnât received any email saying that my application is valid, What Can I do?
                        </span>
                        <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                        </i>
                       </a>
                      </h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                      <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                        <p>
                         <span lang="EN-GB">
                          Be sure that your referees uploaded their recommendation letters, otherwise your application will not be considered as complete and valid.
                         </span>
                        </p>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1575292691296-ee33d0a7-9221">
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                      <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                       <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1575292691296-ee33d0a7-9221">
                        <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                         Can I apply without an official language test?
                        </span>
                        <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                        </i>
                       </a>
                      </h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                      <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                        <p>
                         <span lang="EN-GB">
                          You can apply without an official English test (TOEIC, TOEFL, IELTS, Cambridgeâ¦) if your mother tongue is English or if you can provide a letter from your university attesting your medium of instruction is English.
                         </span>
                        </p>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1582818200480-e84aea3d-89db">
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                      <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                       <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1582818200480-e84aea3d-89db">
                        <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                         My university doesn't do student rankings, how can I do ?
                        </span>
                        <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                        </i>
                       </a>
                      </h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                      <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                       <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                        <p>
                         <span lang="EN-GB">
                          The ranking is not a mandatory document for the application.
                         </span>
                        </p>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>

     <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
       <div class="col-md-8 col-sm-8">
        <h1>
         MOBILITY TRACKS & DEGREES
        </h1>
       </div>
       <div class="pathway col-md-4 col-sm-4 hidden-xs text-right">
        <div class="breadcrumbs" xmlns:v="http://rdf.data-vocabulary.org/#">
         <a href="https://master-bioref.eu/" property="v:title" rel="v:url">
          Home
         </a>
         \
        </div>
        <!-- .breadcrumbs -->
       </div>
      </div>
      <!--/row-->
     </div>
     <!--/container-->
    </div>
    <!--/page-heading-->
    <div class="top-sidebar">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
      </div>
      <!--/row-->
     </div>
     <!--/container-->
    </div>
    <!--/Top sidebar-->
    <div id="body">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="content-pad-3x">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12" id="content" role="main">
         <article class="single-page-content">
          <div class="wpb-content-wrapper">
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1572883066811" style="color: #048f39;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  THE BIOREFINERY MASTER PROGRAMME
                 </strong>
                </h2>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   is a course with the central target of academic excellence. Academic excellence is achieved
                   <em>
                    via
                   </em>
                   a multi-disciplinary forward-looking curriculum, implemented by excellent academics in their respective fields and high quality capable students who will become in the future able graduates of the course, in an international and diverse student and faculty community which will foster greater understanding between cultures and nations.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_center wpb_content_element">
                 <figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure">
                  <div class="vc_single_image-wrapper vc_box_border_grey">
                   <img alt="" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-large" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="568" src="https://master-bioref.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Test-tableau-1.bmp" title="Test tableau" width="762"/>
                  </div>
                 </figure>
                </div>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The structure of the programme and the mobility scheme is shown in the previous scheme . The first semester will open with a one-week summer school organized by Troyes and Bari on
                   <strong>
                    âcatalyst synthesis and characterizationâ,
                   </strong>
                   with teachers from all four Universities, in order to provide a sound basis on catalysis aspects to all students and introduce them to the other academic partners of the Master programme.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1572884152026" style="text-align: left">
                 First Year, Semester 1 at Troyes (France)
                </h3>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   All students will spend their
                   <strong>
                    first semester at Troyes
                   </strong>
                   where courses on
                   <strong>
                    environmental risk management, environmental impact assessment eco-conception of industrial systems through industrial and territorial ecology, bioeconomy basics and environment basics
                   </strong>
                   will be delivered.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The courses will cover technical aspects of energy conversion and management, within a financial, economic, territorial, environmental and legal perspective frame.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Students will also realize group projects on the issues of implementing a sustainable biorefinery. The knowledge-transfer process will develop the necessary skills of the attendants for a successful career in the bioenergy sector.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
                 First Year, Semester 2 at Krakow (Poland)
                </h3>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The
                   <strong>
                    basics of biomass characterisation and production of biofuels
                   </strong>
                   (including lab-synthesis of biodiesel, biethanol, biogas and waste biomass pyrolysis) will be delivered during
                   <strong>
                    second semester of studies in Krakow
                   </strong>
                   .
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   This course will be accompanied with basic courses crucial for chemical engineers, like: calculational methods in chemical engineering; chemical reactions engineering; biochemical reactors engineering; and process control and industrial measurements. Furthermore, an advanced computer modelling methods will be presented to the students, showing them how to solve typical chemical engineering problems.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
                 Second year at Lille (France) or Bari (Italy)
                </h3>
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   <strong>
                    After this first year
                   </strong>
                   , the students can choose between two specialization streams:
                   <br/>
                   a) chemical and thermochemical routes for a lignocellulosic-based biorefinery,
                   <br/>
                   b) enzymatic/microbial/chemical processes for an oil-based biorefinery.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <strong>
                    For stream (a),
                   </strong>
                   students will attend the third semester in Lille, with relevant courses for lignocellulosic biomass conversion and reaction and process engineering related to the biorefinery processes.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <strong>
                    For stream (b),
                   </strong>
                   students will attend one semester with relevant courses in Bari, where both biotechnology and chemical catalysis will be taught.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   A
                   <strong>
                    second common winter school for all students
                   </strong>
                   is envisaged at the end of the first and/or third semester on
                   <strong>
                    environmental assessment and LCA analysis
                   </strong>
                   , a basic skill that is required in all professionals in the energy sector. It will be organized every two years in order that two intakes of students could reach it all together. The mix of two intakes will allow exchanges and experiences and help first year students for their future mobility.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The
                   <strong>
                    fourth and last semester
                   </strong>
                   covers the diploma thesis of the students. The location where the student will perform his/her thesis is a free choice and can be performed in any of the participating institutions. The students will also be strongly encouraged to take advantage of the associated academic and industrial organizations and external associated universities. The four partner Universities agree that specific issues, such as the use of a particular technology-equipment-technique, may require short mobility within the network.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
          </div>
         </article>
        </div>
        <!--/content-->
       </div>
       <!--/row-->

          <div class="wpb-content-wrapper">
           <div class="u_row">

              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading vc_custom_1573759352217" style="color: #289b33;text-align: left">
                 <strong>
                  EMJMD SCHOLARSHIPS
                 </strong>
                </h2>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
             <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
              <div class="vc_column-inner">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   All valid applications submitted before the deadline are automatically considered for the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) scholarship.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Two different types of EMJMD scholarships are awarded:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Scholarships for Program Country students
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Scholarships for Partner Country students (see below the exception for
                    <em>
                     12-months residency rule
                    </em>
                    ) which include some scholarships for students coming from targeted region of the world
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                  <p>
                   To see how EMJMD scholarships are awarded, please refer to the selection procedure section.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

                <h3 class="vc_custom_heading vc_do_custom_heading" style="text-align: left">
                 Students who are awarded an EMJMD scholarship will benefit from the following financial support:
                </h3>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <!--/u_row-->
           <div class="u_row">
            <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">

                      </span>
